basics.name: Sanghun Shin
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate in the Technology Management, Economics and Policy Program (TEMEP) at Seoul National University, specializing in computational modeling of complex socio-technical systems. Dissertation: The Cascade Paradox.

work.summary: M&A due diligence, R&D portfolio review, and open innovation assessment. Financial modeling and time-series forecasting for investment decisions.
highlights: M&A due diligence, R&D portfolio review, and open innovation assessment
Financial modeling and time-series forecasting for investment decisions
Executive decision support and corporate strategy development

work.position: Research Scientist, Medical AI & Big Data
work.summary: Developed AI-guided brain diagnostic systems using medical imaging (MRI, fMRI, PET, CT). Participated in surgical navigation algorithm development for da Vinci robotic surgery system.
highlights: Developed AI-guided brain diagnostic systems using MRI, fMRI, PET, CT
Surgical navigation algorithm development for da Vinci robotic surgery system

work.company: NSF-funded Research Group, University of Wisconsin-Madison
work.summary: Developed epitaxial heterostructures of quantum dots for photovoltaic applications.
highlights: Developed epitaxial heterostructures of lead selenide quantum dots on hematite nanowires
Solved 3-year persistent research challenge, leading to publication in J. Phys. Chem. Lett.

work.position: Aide-de-camp to a 4-Star General, ROK-US Combined Forces Command (CFC)
work.summary: Coordinated high-level military communications and diplomatic protocols.
highlights: Coordinated high-level military communications and diplomatic protocols
Assisted in strategic operations and administrative management

education.area: Ph.D. Candidate, Technology Management, Economics and Policy Program (TEMEP), College of Engineering. Dissertation: The Cascade Paradox. Advisor: Prof. Junseok Hwang

references.reference: Assistant Professor, Department of Clothing & Textiles, Kyung Hee University. eeoom@khu.ac.kr
